title: Coconut Shrimp Risotto
summary: Coconut Shrimp Risotto might be just the side dish you are searching for. One serving contains 227 calories, 10g of protein, and 12g of fat. For $1.47 per serving, this recipe covers 10% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 12. 13 people were impressed by this recipe. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian diet. Head to the store and pick up olive oil, coconut milk, coconut, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 7 minutes. This recipe is typical of Mediterranean cuisine. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 54%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Chili Shrimp and Coconut Risotto, Spicy Coconut Risotto with Lime Shrimp, and Bok Choy Risotto with Coconut Milk and Pan Seared Shrimp.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris with a 4.7 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 46 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Bright yellow/gold color, quite luminous. Superb smoky toasty nose, typical for this grape on limestone in Alsace (no new oak in our wines, just very long total lees contact). Some light reductive aromas that actually fit the style of dry Pinot-Gris. The palate is rich and creamy, with a velvety texture yet fully dry. It is an easy wine to drink now as there is no unnecessary weight. The finish is nice and round but fully dry. The complex limestone blend brings great acid balance and a certain weight. It should develop very nicely over the next few years.
